userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted are noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into three series:
Series 1 - South America Series 2 - Michigan Hill Series 1042 - Photographs

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John Camp was born November 19, 1909, in Ashland County, Ohio. He was one of four children of John W. and Ellen McNab Camp.

He attended public schools in Wayne County and graduated from Wooster High School in 1928. He graduated from Colorado College in Colorado Springs, Colorado, in 1932 with a Bachelor of Science degree in forestry.

After graduating from Cornell University in Ithaca, New York with a Master of Science degree in 1933, John Camp was employed as a forestry technician with the United States Forest Service and became director of the Planning Division in Washington, D. C.
In 1942 he was loaned by the Forest Service to the War Relocation Authority and became assistant director of the industrial division.

In 1943 he was employed by the Institute of Inter-American Affairs in Paraguay as head of the Institute's agricultural mission. In May of 1945 he was transferred to Venezuela as head of the Institute's agricultural mission and director of the Service Cooperativo Inter Americano de Produccion de Alimentos.
In 1947 he joined the International Basic Economy Corporation (IBEC) as a representative in Venezuela.

In 1948 he became director of the American International Association for Economic and Social Development (AIA). In cooperation with the Venezuelan government, he organized the Consejo Inter Americano de Educacion Alimenticia (CIDEA) and the Consejo de Bienestar Rural (CBR) and served on the boards of directors of the agencies. In 1960 he was named by the AIA board as Executive Vice President in charge of all activities of that organization in Latin America.
In 1969 he retired from the AIA and from 1970 to 1977 was employed as a consultant for Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller's 'Michigan Hill' project.

He was a member of the Society of American Foresters, the International Society of Tropical Foresters, the Society of International Development, the Cosmos Club of Washington, D. C., the Cornell Club of New York, and Delta Epsilon, a national honorary scientific society.
He married Emily Patch of Berkshire, New York, in 1934. They had two children. John Camp died in 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The material in this collection covers John Camp's service as director of the agricultural program in Paraguay and Venezuela in the Office of the Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs (1943-1946); representative of the International Basic Economy Corporation (IBEC) in Venezuela (1947-1960); representative in Venezuela (1947-1963), vice-president (1955-1960), and executive vice-president (1961-1969) of the American International Association for Economic and Social Development (AIA); and as consultant (1969-1980) for Nelson Aldrich Rockefeller's 'Michigan Hill' Project, John D. Rockefeller's birthplace, in Tioga County, New York.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The John R. Camp Collection was given to the Rockefeller Archive Center in 1979 and 1982.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Emily Jane Nager completed processing of the collection as of October 30, 1982. Processing Level 3: Standard Processing.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is divided into three subseries:
Subseries 1 - Personal Correspondence, Subseries 2 - Reports, Subseries 3 - Oversized Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: There are five reports in this subseries, several of which are written in Spanish.

did.unittitle: "History of the Office of the Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs"
Trip to Liberia, Ghana, and Nigeria

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 3 consists of an autograph album (1945), a report of the Chief of Party in the Office of the Coordinator of Inter-American Affairs (1943), and an annual report from the same office (1944).

did.unittitle: 'El Personal Del Stica A John R. Camp' - Asuncion, Paraguay

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report to the Chief of Party.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is divided into four subseries:
Subseries 1 - Personal Files, Subseries 2 - Agent Files, Subseries 3 - Reports, Subseries 4 - Artifacts and Maps

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Large maps have been removed to the map collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Included in this subseries is correspondence dating from 1967-1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries concerns the acquisition of property in the John D. Rockefeller Homestead area and includes deeds and clippings pertaining to the Rockefeller family and the Tioga Park (1903-1981).

did.unittitle: Property Acquisition - John D. Rockefeller Homestead
Property Acquisition - Eggleston, Merritt J. and Kathleen J.
Property Acquisition - Zupancic, John and Bernice
Property Acquisition - Pardi, Dolores, and La Salle, Dolores
Property Acquisition - Hubbard, Edgar and Dorothy A.
Property Acquisition - Patton, Mary C.; Tuthill, William; Thorp, Jack and Gabrielle
Property Acquisition - Kachdourian, Mr. and Mrs. P.
Property Acquisition - Zahl, Samuel and Viola
Deeds - Lot 550, 570, 571 - John D. Rockefeller, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: There are eight reports in this subseries; six of these reports have photographic supplements. Of note is Folder 48, which contains a report describing the entire Michigan Hill project and Camp's role in it.

did.unittitle: "The Michigan Hill Project" - John R. Camp
"The Birthplace of John D. Rockefeller" - Joseph W. Ernst
"Restorations on Michigan Hill" - Joseph W. Ernst
"Planning for the Michigan Hill Area" - John R. Camp
"Notes and Drawings About Early Sawmills of Central New York" - William Houghton
"John D. Rockefeller Homestead - 1920's" - Mrs. Kenneth Mead

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Due to the nature and potentially brittle condition of this material, special arrangements may be required in order to view materials. Individual items may be restricted due to preservation concerns.
